medical: GROSS DESCRIPTION: Specimen labeled "sesamoid bone left foot" is received in formalin and consists of three irregular fragments of grey-brown, hard, bony tissue admixed with multiple fragments of brown-tan, rubbery, fibrocollagenous, soft tissue altogether measuring 3.1 x 1.5 x 0.9 cm. The specimen is entirely submitted, after decalcification. DIAGNOSIS: Acute Osteomyelitis, with foci of marrow fibrosis. Focal acute and chronic inflammation of fascia and soft tissue. Arteriosclerosis, severely occlusive.
layman:
The sample, labeled “sesamoid bone left foot,” was received in formalin and contains three irregular pieces of grey‑brown, hard bone tissue mixed with several pieces of brown‑tan, rubbery soft tissue. Together the pieces measure about 3.1 × 1.5 × 0.9 cm. The entire specimen was submitted after it was decalcified.  

**Diagnosis:** Acute bone infection (osteomyelitis) with areas of bone‑marrow scarring. There is localized acute and chronic inflammation of the fascia and surrounding soft tissue. The arteries show severe narrowing (arteriosclerosis).
